titlepage.author: Abel Ramirez

did.head: Descriptive Summary

origination.label: Creator
origination.corpname: E. K. Warren and Son, Inc.

did.unittitle: E. K. Warren and Son, Inc. (Three Oaks, Michigan) Records, 1884-1973 and undated
did.abstract: Records of the E. K. Warren and Son, Inc. from Three Oaks, Michigan and their ranching interests in Mexico, Texas, New Mexico, and Colorado.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University

bioghist.head: Biographical Sketch
bioghist.p: Manufacturers of buggy whips and corset stays, the company was founded by Edward K. Warren, who also invested in Southwestern Land and Cattle through the influence of his son, Charles K. Warren.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Includes correspondence, financial material, legal material, office files, and maps and charts accumulated from the Three Oaks, Michigan, office of E. K. Warren and Son. The collection deals primarily with the financial and legal aspects of Warren's ranching interests in Mexico, Texas, New Mexico, and Colorado. Of particular interest are records dealing with depredations suffered by company ranches in Mexico during the Mexican Revolution of 1910.

arrangement.head: Organization
arrangement.p: The records are organized into the following series:

controlaccess.head: Index Terms
controlaccess.p: The subject headings used by the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library are derived from the Library of Congress and/or locally developed.

controlaccess.head: Subjects (Organizations)

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: E. K. Warren and Son, Inc. (Three Oaks, Michigan) Records, 1884-1973 and undated, Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, Texas Tech University, Lubbock, Texas

relatedmaterial.p: For related materials located in the Southwest Collection/Special Collections Library, see the following collections:
